headline: Almost Everything Is Rallying Ahead of Fed Decision. What’s Not Matters More.
summary: The closest it got was on July 11, 2024 when the index fell 0.9% and 396 stocks gained, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  On that day, it was Tesla, Lam Research, Nvidia, Applied Materials, and Micron that dragged on the index.  This time around Broadcom, Palantir Technologies, and Nvidia were the among the big laggards, but Microsoft, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Tesla, and Amazon.com were also dragging on the index.

headline: ASYS' Cost Reduction Initiatives: Can it Drive Margin Expansion?
summary: Amtech Systems' $13M savings and semi-fabless shift drove Q3 margin gains, with more cost cuts set to fuel profitability.

headline: Applied Materials: Move To The Sidelines For Now (Downgrade)
summary: Applied Materials is downgraded to a hold rating due to cautious near-term outlook despite strong long-term AI-driven prospects.

headline: 3 Volatile Stocks with Open Questions
summary: Volatility cuts both ways - while it creates opportunities, it also increases risk, making sharp declines just as likely as big gains. This unpredictability can shake out even the most experienced investors.

raw.headline: 3 Volatile Stocks with Open Questions

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Stock: Downgraded to Neutral as Competition Rises in China
summary: Applied Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMAT) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight for Investors. On September 11, Mizuho analyst Vijay Rakesh downgraded the stock from Outperform to Neutral with a price target of $175.00 (from $200.00). The firm cited intensifying competition in China and technology transitions that may erode the company’s market share. It noted […]
